'Get up or I'll smash you': French police violence mars September 10 and 18 protests
subhead: Testimonies reveal the violence committed during the protests organized by the 'Block Everything' movement and a coalition of unions. Lawyers criticize 'extremely incomplete files' for the arrests conducted and denounce 'preventive police custody.'

Financial prosecutor says he feels no 'hatred' toward Nicolas Sarkozy and condemns threats on judge
subhead: Since his conviction for letting his aides seek Libyan funding for his 2007 election campaign, ex-president Nicolas Sarkozy has consistently attacked the ruling, which he believes was motivated by the judges' 'hatred.'

title: Eric Adams withdraws from New York City mayoral race, paving way for anti-Mamdani front
subhead: The outgoing mayor announced on Sunday that he would not seek re-election. He gave no clear endorsement ahead of the November 4 election, where the remaining candidates are the democratic socialist Zohran Mamdani, Republican Curtis Sliwa and former New York State Governor Andrew Cuomo.

title: Boys' clubs at work are still a thing
subhead: From the tech 'broligarchy' to after-work sports, informal circles of powerful men remain omnipresent in business and government. They often insidiously promote male exclusivity and hinder professional equality.

title: 'Zucman tax': The great fear of France's ultra-rich
subhead: Amid budget negotiations, the idea of a tax on the wealth of the ultra-rich is provoking an outcry from those affected, even though it is widely supported by the left and backed by public opinion.

French artists and feminists call to honor women who died of illegal abortions
subhead: Activists are calling to build a monument in Paris to honor the women who died from unsafe abortions before abortion was legalized in France in 1975.

title: How can Europe withstand pressure from Russia and the US? Two experts debate
subhead: hTensions with Russia to the East and the United States to the West are testing Europe's model. Sylvain Kahn and Guillaume Lagane examine this shifting landscape and the possible responses.

title: Relationship sex: Why many women still feel pressure to say yes
subhead: Many women have sex with their partners even when they do not want to, out of reluctance to say no, uncertainty about desire, or fear of offending. Together, these reasons sketch the contours of a gray zone of consent.
